mlr3torch 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Entrypoint to Torch Network

    mlr_pipeops_torch_ingress.Rd

    Use this as entry-point to mlr3torch-networks. Unless you are an advanced user, you should not need to use this directly but PipeOpTorchIngressNumeric, PipeOpTorchIngressCategorical or PipeOpTorchIngressImage.

    Format

    R6Class inheriting from PipeOp.

    Construction

    PipeOpTorchIngress$new(id, param_set = ps(), param_vals = list(), packages = character(0), feature_types)

    • id :: character(1)
      The id for the object.

    • param_set :: link{ParamSet}{paradox}
      The parameter set.

    • param_vals :: named list()
      List of hyperparameter settings to overwrite the initial values. Default is list().

    • input :: data.table()
      The input channels for this PipeOp. See PipeOp for an explanation.

    • output :: data.table()
      The output channels for this PipeOp. See PipeOp for an explanation.

    • packages :: character() \cr The packages this PipeOpTorchIngress` depends on.

    • feature_types :: character()
      The features types that can be consumed by this PipeOpTorchIngress. Must be a subset of mlr_reflections$task_feature_types.

    Input and Output Channels

    One input channel called "input" and one output channel called"output". For an explanation see PipeOpTorch.

    State

    The state is set to the input shape.

    Parameters

    Defined by the construction argument param_set, as well as:

    • select :: logical(1)
      Whether to select the features of the task that can be consumed by this PipeOpTorchIngress. Default is FALSE, i.e. it errs during training if it receives a task with feature types that it cannot handle.

    Fields

    • feature_types :: character(1)
      The features types that can be consumed by this PipeOpTorchIngress.

    Methods

    Only methods inherited from PipeOpTorch/PipeOp{mlr3pipelines}].

    Internals

    Creates an object of class TorchIngressToken for the given task. The purpuse of this is to store the information on how to construct the torch dataloader from the task for this entry point of the network.

    See also

    Other PipeOp: mlr_pipeops_torch_ingress_img

    Contents

    Developed by Sebastian Fischer, Lukas Burk, Martin Binder.
